string-array.name: planet_information
string-array.item: Mercury is the smallest and closest planet to the Sun. It has a rocky surface and no atmosphere to speak of.
Venus has a thick, toxic atmosphere rich in carbon dioxide and clouds of sulfuric acid, making it the hottest planet.
Earth is the only planet known to support life, with liquid water, a protective atmosphere, and diverse ecosystems.
Mars, known as the Red Planet, has a thin atmosphere and evidence of ancient rivers and possibly microbial life.
Jupiter is the largest planet, a gas giant with a Great Red Spot â€” a massive storm lasting centuries.
Saturn is famous for its spectacular ring system made of ice and rock particles orbiting the gas giant.
Uranus rotates on its side and has a blue-green color due to methane in its cold atmosphere.
Neptune, the farthest planet, has supersonic winds and a vivid blue hue caused by atmospheric methane.
